components.description:
A snail, a slow-moving, snail-like mollusk in a spiraling shell. Generally depicted as a brown snail in full profile facing left or right, with a brown, textured shell and tentacle-like eyes.

May be used to represent a slug and various senses of slow.

Twitter’s snail has a purple body and yellow shell. Microsoft’s snail previously had a green body.
components.title: Snail

title: Snail

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Animal symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: A¬†snail shown with distinctive spiral shell. Differs greatly in color and style across different platforms. Snail was approved as part of Un http://emojipedia.org/snail/
emoji_net_data.name: snail

bn:00110772a: Slow; having little motion; as, a sluggish stream.

bn:00110767a: Not moving quickly; taking a comparatively long time
Not happening in a short time; spread over a comparatively long time.
Spread over a comparatively long time.

bn:00087480v: Advance slowly, as if by inches

bn:00072374n: Snail is a common name that is applied most often to land snails, terrestrial pulmonate gastropod molluscs.
Any of very many animals (either hermaphroditic or nonhermaphroditic), of the class Gastropoda, having a coiled shell.
Any animal of the class Gastropoda having a shell.
Freshwater or marine or terrestrial gastropod mollusk usually having an external enclosing spiral shell
(Gastropoda) Ventral footed mollusk, including land snails, terrestrial pulmonate gastropod mollusks.
